title: Download images for audit collector (GCP)
content:
RoleLocation
Suite administratorBastion node

Before you deploy the suite, you need to download the suite images from Docker Hub or other registries and then upload the images to your registry.

If you already uploaded images to your registry, skip this step.

Generate image set

Before downloading and uploading the images, you need to generate the image set with the following steps:

  1. Run the following command to change directory:
    cd <OMT_External_K8s_2x.x-xxx>/tools/generate-download

  2. Run the following command to display the command-line options for the generate_download_bundle command:
    ./generate_download_bundle.sh -h

  3. Run the generate_download_bundle.sh command together with the options required by your deployment. For example, run the following command. Replace all the placeholders with the actual values.
    ./generate_download_bundle.sh --chart <Audit service Helm chart> -o hpeswitom -d <offline-download.zip location>
    For example:
    ./generate_download_bundle.sh --chart Audit_Collector_Helm_Chart-2x.x/audit-helm-charts/charts/audit-collector-1.2.0+2x.x.x-xx.tgz -o hpeswitom -d /tmp

    Note that this example contains placeholder values.

    The offline-download.zip will be in the /tmp directory as specified. This file lists the required images, and you can use it when running the script to download and upload the suite images.

Download the required installation images

  1. Log on to the first control plane node or the bastion node. If that node can't access Docker Hub, transfer the  offline-download.zip  file to a Linux server that can access Docker Hub.
  2. Extract the .zip package to a directory. If you can't access Docker Hub directly, set up the HTTP/HTTPS proxy. For example, run the following commands to set the HTTP/HTTPS proxy. Replace the placeholders with your actual server and port. 
    export http_proxy="<http://PROXY_SERVER:PORT>"
    export https_proxy="<https://PROXY_SERVER:PORT>"
  3. Go to the directory you extracted the offline-download.zip package into.
  4. Run the following command:
      
    ./downloadimages.sh -u <username>  -d <image download directory> -c on|off -o <org name>

    Where:

    • Replace <username> with the Docker Hub username.
    • If you don't specify the credentials here, you will be prompted to specify them when you run the command.
    • <image download directory>: The directory where the container images will be downloaded. The default value is /var/opt/cdf/offline.
    • The -c option is used to verify the digital signature of the images during the download. The default setting is off, which doesn't verify the signature.
    • <org name>: The organization in the image registry that contains the images for installation. By default, this is hpeswitom. This option is mandatory if you aren't using the default organization name.

To see the full list of options for the downloadimages.sh command, run the following command:
./downloadimages.sh –h
The command also has a -p option to provide your password. The -p  option doesn't support single quotes (don't include single quotes in the password).

Note: OpenText encourages you to use some other password options, which aren't provided by OpenText. By implementing the -p option, you may expose the system to increased security risks. Upload the images

Follow these steps to upload the installation images to your external image registry:

  1. Log in to one of the bastion nodes. The node must be able to connect to the external registry.
  2. Run the following command to get GCP password. 
    gcrpwd=$(gcloud auth print-access-token)
  3. Go to the directory you extracted the offline-download.zip package into.
  4. Run the following command to upload the suite images to the external registry: 
    ./uploadimages.sh -r 'gcr.io' -u oauth2accesstoken -p $gcrpwd -d <image download directory> -o <org name>
    Where:
    • <image download directory>: The directory to which you downloaded the container images. The default value is /var/opt/cdf/offline. Specify the -d option if the images aren't in the /var/opt/cdf/offline/ directory. You can use the -d option multiple times when the images are in different directories. The images can be the images downloaded by the downloadimages.sh. Make sure the image file type matches the file extension. 
    • <org name>: The organization in the image registry that contains the images for installation. By default, this is hpeswitom. This option is mandatory if you aren't using the default organization name.
    • --cleanup: Delete the image source folder to save disk space. It only works when all images are uploaded successfully.

    To see the full list of options for the uploadimages.sh command, run the following command:

    ./uploadimages.sh -h 

  5. Wait until the images are successfully uploaded. Your terminal should resemble the following: 
    Upload-process successfully completed.
